settings.caption: Tillandsia
settings.heading: Airplant Care Guide
settings.text: Fall in love with airplantsâ€”marvels of the plant world that need no soil to grow. These etherial species belong to the genus Tillandsia, originating mostly in Central and South America, with a few species native to the Southern United States.

settings.caption: Platycerium
settings.heading: Staghorn fern Care Guide
settings.text:
Transform your space with the architectural grandeur genus Platycerium, commonly known as "staghorn ferns."

These living sculptures bring the Australian rainforest canopy into your home or garden, offering stunning focal points that evolve over years of careful cultivation.

settings.caption: Neoregelia
settings.heading: Neoregelia Care Guide
settings.text: Members of the genus Neoregelia practically explode with color. For fans of geometric forms, striking lines, and stunning blooms, Neoregelias will bring visual interest (to say the least) to indoor arrangements and outdoor gardens.
